alert.note: Alert for Charles City; James City; Prince George; Surry; Sussex; York (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 04 at 2:31PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Charles City, central Prince George, northwestern York, north central Sussex, central James City, and northwestern Surry Counties and the City of Williamsburg through 315 PM EDT... At 231 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Toano to Claremont to near Disputanta. Movement was northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Williamsburg, Claremont, College Of William And Mary, Queens Lake, Disputanta, Norge, Rustic, Burrowsville, York Terrace, Carver Gardens, Kings Point, Jamestown, Cabin Point, Taylors Corner, Camp Peary, Spring Grove, Ewell, Gwaltney Corner, Oak Hill Corner and Williamsburg Airport. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects.

area.areaDesc: Charles City; James City; Prince George; Surry; Sussex; York
